Reviews.Title: “Great stay and great value!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a La Quinta traveler
Reviews.Content: This LQ is definitely a good find. The location for in and out of airport and car rental attracted me to try it. I was definitely not disappointed. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Ver pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: retiredtraveler142
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a place near the airport, I strongly recommend this. We stayed twice (going/returning) and found the LaQuinta virtually flawless. The shuttle to and from the airport, even leaving the hotel at 4 AM on our first stay and returning at 1 AM on our second, was very quick, the drivers consistently courteous and helpful. The check-in was as quick and seamless as that of any other hotel at which we have stayed. The room was large (king bed), very nicely furnished and clean. The beds were very comfortable. Even though it is right next to the (very active) airport, there was no noticeable jet noise in the room. There are several nearby restaurants, within easy walking distance, even in the ever-present Seattle rain. The complimentary breakfast, including a "make-it-yourself" waffle, and the normal cereal, baked goods, toast, juice, coffee, etc., was adequate. Since our first stay meant leaving before normal breakfast hours, the staff arranged for a few breakfast items for us before we left. That gesture was typical of the staff, who seemed to go out of their way for us. It takes a lot for us to give a five-star review. La Quinta (Seattle airport) deserves it. For an overnight between flights, we shall definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Just one night”
Reviews.Author: mytrip784
Reviews.Content: Stayed on our way back from trip to California. Daughter wanted to see Seattle the next morn. before going home to B.C. Had the dog with us so we decided to stay at the La Quinta. This was on Jan 1, 2012. The girl at the front desk was very nice. New at hotel traveling with a dog. Was happy to learn they did not charge extra for our 6 mo old pup. Charged $25 or more other places. The price was right but it is true the place is pretty run down. Needs new carpet especially in the halls. Windows real dirty could hardly see the airport. Bad lighting in the rooms. Standard breakfast. The area to let your dog go was covenient and there was bags provided. Come on people pick up after your dogs! I have to say though one reason might be that they put the pags as far away from the doors as possible and you have to walk across the grass to get one. Meanwhile trying to walk through the grass at night and stepping in stuff that others didn't bother to clean up after their dogs. might help to move the bags closer? Would only stay again because I had my dog and if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Fast escape to the airport in the morning from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: aybceo
Reviews.Content: Good strategic location for a fast escape to Sea-Tac Airport in the morning (airport is approximately 10 minutes away by hotel shuttle, which departs the hotel every 30 minutes). However, this La Quinta is rundown, and needs a complete refurbishment. On the day I checked in, water was off for several hours. Service was restored by early evening. Lobby and rooms need upgrading, but they are serviceable. No good views, but the rooms seem to be relatively quiet (3rd floor). Elevators are dark and dreary. Front desk staff was cheerful and trying hard to please. Located next to a Denny's, near service stations, and a busy intersection. Hotel landscaping is non-existent. (Plant a tree, La Quinta: it will grow in 10 minutes, like everything else in the Pacific NW!)

Reviews.Title: “Fooled by good reviews”
Reviews.Author: Judigcat
Reviews.Content: After staying at this hotel for two nights (up arrival for vacation and before departure) I am amazed that it has gotten such good reviews. The hotel is rundown and when we were there the staff at the desk was very disorganized. The bathtub in both rooms but particularly the first one looked so dirty that I did not want to step in it with my bare feet. My husband was ill and when I explained to the desk clerk that we needed to be picked up as soon as possible from the train - she was less than helpful. The most courteous and helpful person was the shuttle driver who went out of her way to be of assistance. Additionally, I have no problem that this hotel allows pets (I have my own) but while in the lobby a guest came in with her dogs (2) one peed on the carpet and while the woman did attempt to clean it up with a paper towel- nothing was done by the staff to make sure it was thoroughly cleaned up.,

Reviews.Title: “Stay here. It's a wonderful value.”
Reviews.Author: James M
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay. Quiet and a wonderful bed. Great location. Went to 13 Coins for dinner, very disappointed. Don't waste your money. The young lady at the front desk sent me 3 miles to a liquor store when there was one next door I could have walked to. The staff should know better than that, I think. Hit Dave's Dinner across the street for a great breakfast or a cocktail.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased!”
Reviews.Author: Bosanchubo
Reviews.Content: Reviews of this property indicated this would be a place to meet our needs on the evening before flying out of SEATAC. Airport noise was not a problem, even though we were close; boarding passes could be printed from the hotel's lobby computer; breakfast was appreciated; parking was free; returning a rental car at the airport was easy. People at the front desk were friendly and helpful, and offered several suggestions for restaurants that were within walking distance. Our room was very neat, clean, comfortable, and quiet. Requesting a room away from smoking areas of the hotel is important, based on other reviews. Special pricing is available through AARP. We would definitely choose this hotel another time, if we were in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Watch for smoking rooms on top floor”
Reviews.Author: Somervillemom
Reviews.Content: I made reservations on the phone, asking for a top-floor room if it was nonsmoking. (At hotels near airports, people come in late and leave early, so I find the top floor to be quietest.) I believe the woman at the 800 number said the whole hotel was nonsmoking. When we checked in, I again said I'd like top floor if it was nonsmoking, and was told we had a room on the 6th floor. I noticed a stale cigarette smell in the lobby, but thought it could be coming in from outside. When we walked through the 6th floor hallway, past doors marked "No Smoking," we could all smell cigarette smoke clearly as if someone in one or more of those rooms were smoking. Our room, also marked No Smoking, had a cigarette smell. I called the front desk to say that someone on our floor was smoking, and they told me that half the 6th floor IS smoking rooms, and they had no other nonsmoking rooms with 2 beds. I went out in the hall again and found that the next room after ours was indeed for smokers, so I called back to ask for a new room, even if we needed a cot for the kids. After first telling me there were no more rooms with 2 beds, they found a room for us on the 5th floor, and the rest of our stay was fine. However, when people request nonsmoking rooms, they most likely do not want to be anywhere near a smoking room, and so I was very disappointed in this experience. Earlier in the week, we stayed at the Everett LQ which was entirely nonsmoking, and so I had thought LaQunta hotels had started to go smoke-free. One interesting point -- the desk clerk said the only other room free was "way down the hall" on another floor. I thought she meant it was right next to the elevators, which I find a terrible place to sleep due to the noise of people coming and going, but she meant it was the last room at the end of the hall. As such, it was very quiet and we managed to have a quiet night's sleep before catching a 7 am flight. (We could hear airplanes taking off or landing, but it sounded like thunder in the distance and didn't keep us awake.) So, if you want a smoke-free room, don't book a top floor room at this hotel. The other thing we didn't like was that they were playing the TV really loud in the lobby (and on a politically obnoxious station...). The room itself was fine, but didn't have a fridge, which I thought was part of the deal too. We were on the side of the hotel facing the airport, with a view of the parking garage, but there was little traffic noise. (Our first smoky room had a view of Mt Rainer but also faced the street.) Since we left early in the morning, we didn't get the breakfast (which starts at 6), but there were some muffins and coffee available when we caught the 5:30 shuttle. The shuttle took about 8 minutes to reach our stop.

Reviews.Title: “This may be the best La Quinta that we've stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: Goldwingtriker
Reviews.Content: This property is the most "hotel" like LaQuinta that we've stayed in. The rooms are spacious with excellent cable TV and an HDTV mounted on the wall. There is good Wifi coverage throughout the hotel and access is free. They even have a free public access computer with printer in the lobby. A free shuttle is provided to pick up and deliver to the SEA-TAC airport. On arrival jsut call the hotel. The hotel also offers long term parking while you fly at the hotel. While ther is a continental breakfast it is minimal, but adequate. There are a limited number of USA Today newspapers in the lobby for free. All in all, this is a great (maybe the best) La Quinta. I highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Good service, decent rooms and price”
Reviews.Author: Pat M
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the La Quinta in in Seattle, near the airport, and it served our need well. The front desk staff was very friendly and kind. There is a complimentary breakfast available and no additional charge for parking. My only concern was that the toilet seat wouldn't stay up in our room, but I informed the front desk of that when we checked out and I am confident that they addressed the problem. The pool is outdoors, which doesn't bother me, but I figured that it is with mentioning, since I heard someone ask where the indoor pool was located (there is not indoor pool). There is a shuttle to the airport, which I believe starts at 4:39 am.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Airport Stay!”
Reviews.Author: happymcmartin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel when we had to catch an early flight. It was right by the airport and easy access for in the morning. Staff was friendly and parking was easy. Lobby could use a little updating but is functional. Rooms were nice and clean the only downside is it's 2 Doubles and not 2 Queens for 4 people. Pool was good and so was the breakfast. I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong here”
Reviews.Author: Aichilik
Reviews.Content: I always find La Quinta to be a solid value, with a reliably safe location, smoke free rooms, no annoying charge for wifi and friendly staff. Plus they happily take dogs with no charge . . . even when I'm traveling without my dogs that alone is enough to nudge me in their direction. No they aren't the fanciest, but honestly I would take solid, reliable and safe over fancy for most of my travel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable rooms, GREAT staff, but ... a little expensive ...”
Reviews.Author: travelguyuth
Reviews.Content: The rooms here are very clean and comfortable. The staff is incredibly good, very friendly and helpful. We really got a warm feeling from staying here even though it was only one night. The only drawbacks were that it was a little bit expensive and the rooms were a little on the small side. Also, the breakfast in the morning was not as expansive as it could have been. I think it is kind of an older property also. Besides that, I can definitely recommend this hotel for a night or two considering the very good staff and the rooms are comfortable and clean. For a longer stay you might want to find a place with larger rooms though.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay with two large dogs”
Reviews.Author: jcoalter
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great in regards me having my two large dogs. They have a great area for dogs and were able to assist me in getting us to the airport on time. They were very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “I'll Be Back”
Reviews.Author: Rosementko
Reviews.Content: Spent the night with girlfriends. We are traveling from Alaska to Florida. Seattle is a stopover. We got neighboring rooms. The shuttle was timely. The price was right. I had a restful sleep. Staff was great. A special thank you to Marcia the van driver. She was so helpful in answering all of our questions. The room was comfortable and spacious. I did a black light inspection of the room and as with most hotels, there were visible urine stains on the front ot the toilet. People just can't seem to hit that big open toilet!! The front desk staff gave us a good recommendation for dinner. While there, we met two other people from our home town of Juneau, Alaska. And it turns out that they were also staying at La Quinta. This morning my wakeup call was on time. The morning crowd at the breakfast was quite happy and chatty. There is a dog show and La Quinta does allow pets. In the shower,there was plenty of water pressure and lots of hot water. The bar soap was luxurious. It must be some kind of castile soap as it was so sudsy and felt like silk. It is the small things that matter. Overall, I would give this hotel an A. Price was right, location was close to the airport, shuttle was timely, room was clean, bed was perfect, shower was hot. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: LDSH
Reviews.Content: I called to make a reservation for my parents because they were coming in on a late flight and there was a snow storm covering the Seattle area and the roads were horrible. The reservation desk took my information, including credit card number, and gave me a reservation number. When my parents called from the airport to be picked up, the front desk said the reservation number was invalid and they were booked since this afternoon. My parents were able to find another room. My prayer now is that the reservation desk did not steal my credit card number.

Reviews.Title: “Ok- Been to better La Quinta's”
Reviews.Author: Traveldanse
Reviews.Content: Lighting was great, typical La Quinta layout and furnishings. Bedding comfortable, windows open for fresh air which I appreciate. A little on the chintzy side for amenties: not a lot of TV channels (in Seattle??) 1 coffee and 1 condiment packet, 1 shampoo and 2 little soaps. I had to hunt for a complimentary newspaper and there were only 2 left at the front desk at 7:15am. I'm an upper level Rewards member and only perk was express check-in. Breakfast ok, nothing to write home about, and no evening cookies like some LaQ's have. At check-in, front desk offered no information about facility amenities, breakfast, anything. Had I been told there was a restaurant, I might have ordered room service. Instead I walked across the lot to the Jack in the Box. Business center monitor/screen filthy. Nice size room w/fridge (which was leaking inside) and a microwave. Great shower/water flow. Reasonably quiet for being that close to the airport and I believe they offer an airport shuttle and there are a few other restaurants in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Service and Smiles”
Reviews.Author: Quiltingangler
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff and a convenient location for SeaTac airport will bring me back. The desk staff was welcoming and helpful. Not only did they help with dinner directions, but they also offered to call the shuttle because it was raining. We needed a handicap room and were wowed by the design making access very easy for wheelchair users. The room was clean and quiet even though it is so close to the airport. The breakfast area was kept stocked and clean by a friendly lady with the usual waffles, fresh fruit, yogurt and cereals. With many restaurants, gas stations and rental car return lots within a few blocks, we were able to make a quick smooth exit after out travels to return home.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible pillows, Slow internet”
Reviews.Author: AGSTX
Reviews.Content: The pillows at this location are lumpy and have no support. Terrible on the neck. They advertise High Speed Internet, but after 5 speed tests with Tech Support, it never even got close to High Speed - 64KB. I'm finding the bad pillows and the slow internet at many La Quinta locations. This chain have been one of my favorites for 17 years, but it's time to move on. The quality has greatly decreased.

Reviews.Title: “nice & close to airport”
Reviews.Author: Pursja
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was very helpful. Fast & easy check in & out. Computer with printer in lobby free to use for guests. Shuttle to airport although it is within walking distance. Several restaurants also within walking distance. Room was clean and large. I loved the king -sized bed. Most hotels only have queens & the extra room was nice to spread out.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hotel but not a great value”
Reviews.Author: nancinmofo
Reviews.Content: The bed was very uncomfortable, television was at least 10 years old, and it was priced a bit high for what I got

Reviews.Title: “Wow... What a great stay”
Reviews.Author: sdp5698
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful this hotel has, everyone was nice and helpful. We had reservation at another property, got there, checked in and quickly checked out. By the time we made it to the La Quinta it was pretty late and the family and I were ready to call it a day. The staff was so genuinely nice and helpful, I wish I had paid more attention to their names they were all so great. The rooms were squeaky clean, the beds very comfy and just over all a great room. They put out a small breakfast in the am, a much larger selection then I was expecting. They also did a great job at keeping it stocked and cleaned. Over all I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Always Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: goodtravels2009
Reviews.Content: Stay here often. Usually very comfortable and consistant. Rooms are average but have always found them clean. Breakfast fare is pretty standard..muffins, toast, cereal, waffles etc. Easy access to the airport. Denny's and several burger places next door. Easy to get a quick meal before heading out. Good shuttle service. Recommend you book room directly on their website. I have found these are the best rates. I always book as a senior...almost there age wise and they give you a discount. Have never been checked at checking to verify my age. Maybe I look older than I am !

Reviews.Title: “La Quinta Inn - Seatac (Seattle Airport)”
Reviews.Author: TJ-USA
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the hotel. Found the hotel to be modestly clean, well kept and had not problems. It was relatively smooth from check in to check out. Rates were reasonable and its extemely close to the Seattle/Tacoma Airport. Despite the proximity, did not find the flight traffic to produce any significant noise factor. The beds were comfortable and moderately equipped with the expected essentials. The hotel does offer a complimentary continental breakfast which consisted of cereal, milk, waffles (you make them in the waffle iron), bagels, cream cheese, juices, coffee, bread for toasting, yogurt, fruit and hard boiled eggs. Although there is an eating area, it is far too small for the number of potential guests during busier periods. Including myself, many were scattered throughout the lobby and reception area eating their breakfast or you took it back to your room. That was about the only negative was the lack of a larger eating area. The shuttle was convenient as well. All in all, a good stay with no problems. Very reasonable for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and clean room”
Reviews.Author: ExpeditionMan
Reviews.Content: Stayed one evening in the Seattle airport LaQuinta. Was pleasantly surprised by my spacious room and the continental breakfast. Shuttle to airport runs on time and driver was very friendly. needed to wash some clothes and the dryer was the best working hotel dryer I've ever used. You're within walking distance to a handful of restaurants, fast food, a pub and some others. Wish the shuttle could run you to Southcenter for some shopping. Internet worked great. Met friends over at Southcenter where there are a lot of restaurants to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the price.”
Reviews.Author: akmoma
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights here coming and going on a trip to Hawaii. We thought it was ok for the price $70.00. The beds were only doubles not queens and they did not restock the breakfast. Not a great place but not bad for the price either.Our room was plenty clean and the service was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy heater, no breakfast”
Reviews.Author: jhmikkelsen
Reviews.Content: Had an overnight stay before next flight. The room had a very noisy heater, which had to be turned on overnight to keep the room warm. Hotel offers breakfast, but it stops already at 9am, which is very early for an airport hotel and your are not informed very much about this. So we`ll find another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “maids keeping jacket”
Reviews.Author: l12252
Reviews.Content: I stayed October 5, 2008. When I left the next morning at 7:15 I went across the street and checked into the DoubleTree for a conference. My room was ready at the DoubleTree so I was able to unpack my things before the conference. I noticed than that my green jacket to match my pants wasn't there. I called the La Quinta and the front desk said housekeeping wasn't in yet please call at 10:00. At that time I told the front desk that my jacket was in the closet, please hold it for me. I called back at 11:30 and the front desk said housekeeping doesn't bring lost and founds until the end of the day. I called back at the end of the day and got the same run-a-round. Called the next day and same run-a-round. I'm very disappointed in the cleaning staff they have at the property. It's not a place I would want to leave anything in my room because most likely the maids will come in and have sticky fingers. linda

Reviews.Title: “OK at best”
Reviews.Author: trip89
Reviews.Content: OK - had a drippy shower - it is also dated, a little run down and drab. Fine if you don't have to spend very much time here.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: suecag
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked for a business trip. I stayed here on two separate nights (before and after my drive to central WA). I stayed in the King rooms 603 and 401. The staff SLAMs doors constantly in the morning. It is extremely loud and irritating. The room doors themselves don't close properly. The TV reception is horrible, all snow and buzzing. The shower slows to a trickle intermittently - maybe when someone else is showering at the same time? The hot and cold water is reversed in both the sink and the tub. The sink doesn't drain. The ice machine was broken. There is no WIFI as expected but there is plug in Internet. Check-in took a long time. There is no microwave or fridge or any other extra ammenity like that in the King rooms. The location is convenient to the airport and rental car lots. I rented a car so I can't comment on the shuttle service, sign says it is every 30 minutes. On the positive side, the furniture in both rooms was nice and the rooms seem clean. The bedding was skimpy. I believe that there is better out there. There are numerous hotels in the area. I won't be coming back to this one nor will anyone from my company.

Reviews.Title: “Just right”
Reviews.Author: Jean_Valjean
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property on Friday September 5th and again on Friday September 12th, 2008. On our first night we had a room facing south on the 6th floor. We actually had a decent view of Mt. Rainier. On our second visit we had a group of 7 adults and shared three double bed rooms, all located off the lobby area on the ground level. On both visits all of our rooms were clean, quiet, and equipped with all the standard amenities. The rooms were a little small but we had space for our things and there is a desk and two chairs, good for any work you would need to do. Check in was quick and easy with two staff members available to assisting us in getting our group settled. There is a computer and printer with internet available in the lobby. The front desk was able to help us with several fax and other business related needs. There is a free breakfast with both hot and cold selections available, not a large selection but certainly adequate. For my needs it was a great location. Located close enough to SEA-TAC to walk but they have a shuttle that runs from 4:30 AM until 11PM. We used both extremes and each time it was quick and hassle free. From the airport just pick up the courtesy phone and call the hotels code. There is an added bonus for those renting cars from Enterprise. Pickup and return is one block south of the hotel on International.

Reviews.Title: “clean but spartan”
Reviews.Author: hisim
Reviews.Content: we needed a hotel close to the seattle airport, and free breakfast was the inducement. the room was sparkling. not a smudge on the walls or mirrors could be seen. the wake up call was right on time, and the shuttle to the airport left on schedule. breakfast was adequate. no frills at all, however.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Overnight Hotel prior to Cruise”
Reviews.Author: kepMissouri
Reviews.Content: Arrived at La Quinta evening prior to an Alaskan Cruise. Free airport shuttle and clean rooms. Best part about this hotel was the location. Very short walking distance to a liquor store which sold wine (to take on the cruise). Also were able to take advantage of local transportation (Seattle Express) to the cruise terminal...they picked us up ten minutes before our scheduled time, and the front desk staff called our room to let us know they had arrived. Seattle hotels can be a bit pricey, so we were thrilled to have stumbled upon this value hotel through hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: TravelsWithDoggie
Reviews.Content: The good - the hotel is easy to access from I-5, rooms are nice and spacious, staff is friendly and accomodating on check in, great pet policy, double windows keep SeaTac noise out, felt entirely safe in the location. The bad - the stay was great. A billing snafu went from snafu to ugly as 'good customer service' appears to only apply when there are no problems. Their response was so over the top, I really thought their message was fake. Overall, the hotel is good, management in my opinion, needs a few more sessions in maintaining customer relations to avoid poisoning the brand.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Airport & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: AgentJim
Reviews.Content: Great for a quick rest. Had to take the red eye out of Sea Tac and needed a place to sleep. Usually I would say this is about a 2 star hotel but it gets a much better rating this time. They let us check in before 11 AM and we were going to check out at 10 PM and did for our flight. Good clean comfortable room for a days sleep so you won't be totally exhausted. We took a cruise and need an inexpensive place that was not a flea bag hotel to sleep. The front desk was very courteous in letting us check in early. The rooms while plain were clean and comfortable and mostly quiet for being so close to the airport. Free shuttle was very convenient even if the shuttle driver did complain about his job the entire time and wasn't sure where to drop us off as he only knew where Delta and Southwest were, not the airline we were using. After a few trips around the terminal he finally with another passenger's help figured it out. Would recommend this hotel for a one night stay when flying in/out of Sea-Tac

Reviews.Title: “Stuck in the Elevator....”
Reviews.Author: Darenc
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying at the LQ Seattle Airport res and today is 1.31.08. I've just spent the last 40 min in a stuck elevator...here is a recap of the experience: Upon determining that the elevator was actually stuck I attempted to use the “call” button in the unit…simply to hear it ring through, be answered and hung up… I finally got through to the front desk on my cell phone….where I was told to “push some more buttons….that usually works”. As I told them that I had already done that and that the buttons were just staying lit up…they simply indicated “I can’t take this again”…..from there I was disconnected. At this point I called 911 where they patched me through to the front desk again and with the operator they indicated “they were working on it”…and again was hung up on. After ~ 40 min I was able to pry the door open on my own…..in going down to the front desk and indicated that “I am the one that was stuck in the elevator” I was simply looked at and asked how I got out…..there was no concern, no empathy and no true sigh of any attempt to reach out…one of the ppl was on the phone and simply gave me the “hush finger” and the other person simply stared at me. I finally just left my business card and went out to get a quick dinner. Upon my return the same person was behind the desk and visiting with someone else and again no attempt to even check in with me. I am not claustrophobic and completely understand that things like this happen…..here are my concerns. 1. After numerous attempts to try and reach out from my end to express the situation there was absolutely no attempt to check in with me, physically bang on the door, keep in contact, inquires if I had any medical conditions, etc…..basically provide a bit of reassurance and understanding of the situation I was in. 2. It appears that this is not an uncommon occurrence. That in it’s self is concerning. 3. After getting myself out there was absolutely no attempt to reach out, apologize inquire as to my well being etc… I have been a long LQ client and have noticed a dramatic drop of in service and quality…for instance the room I am in this time the desk chair is broken…but still in the room?? I also provided this information to LQ corporate in the hope that it can be used as a training tool and feedback of how “not” to handle a situation.

Reviews.Title: “Great One-Nighter”
Reviews.Author: Bump-In-The-Night
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Quinta SeaTac one night on Jan 11/2008 in advance of a flight the following morning. The airport shuttle service and drivers were excellent and the room was much better than expected. Desk staff were courteous and friendly, hotel was quiet and the room was very clean. Complimentary continental breakfast was tasty (waffle maker !!) and (free) wireless internet access for my laptop was appreciated. Only drawback to Free computer access in lobby was that inkjet printer was out of ink so couldn't print boarding passes. Front desk explained that it was a contracted service to the hotel and couldn't do anything about it. Suggest upgrading to laserjet printer and having spare cartridges on hand. Overall, an excellent restful stay that kicked off our Florida vacation perfectly. Also a pet-friendly hotel, always appreciated since we often travel with our dog. Would definately stay again for any SeaTac early departure or late arrival.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay again”
Reviews.Author: jjg39069
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the reviews for SeaTac area hotels on here (and discovering there's some scary places there) this was where I determined was the best place for the $$. We were satisfied. I'd definitely go back w/o even looking for another place around SeaTac. Friendly and timely free shuttle to and from airport. The bathroom was definitely clean (I gave it a good look after seeing a complaint about that by an earlier poster). Free internet access (computer provided) in the lobby. Looks like there was internet in the rooms although we didn't try to hook up ourselves. Continental breakfast was good as well. We had no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Dependable”
Reviews.Author: moonshot
Reviews.Content: Stay often when traveling thru Seattle. Never disapointed. This property is probably an average to above average 'airport' hotel. Never had problems with staff or dirty rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experience”
Reviews.Author: gorgeous_alberta
Reviews.Content: I arrived with my family at 3:00 AM due to a delayed flight, and we were told that our booking (through Expedia) was not received by La Quinta Inns (SEA-TAC). We were treated to a rude welcome by the night receptionist who gave us a lecture on what we should do next time to avoid situations like this. We were standing there with a sick six-year old in the middle of the night, listening to the receptionist's comments and not knowing whether we would have a place to sleep. The proper way to handle this would have been to re-assure us that a room is available and that any problems with our reservation could be sorted out the next day (I had a hard copy of the reservation with me and the receptionist saw that it was already paid in full and it was for the correct date and La Quinta location). I also want to note that our stay was otherwise fine, I liked the free wireless AND wired Internet connection (there are some security issues with wireless access in some hotels), the day staff were courteous and tried to resolve the issues as quickly as they could. I also complained to La Quinta through their website, and they seemed pretty responsive. The place was clean and was very convenient for a one night stay flying into Seattle and then driving on the next day. (Note: from what I can tell, the lost booking was La Quinta's fault, but they are still looking into the issue.)

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel if flying out of Seatac”
Reviews.Author: KChopin
Reviews.Content: La Quinta is a well located, quiet, and clean hotel. We had a noon flight from the airport to the East Coast and needed a good night's sleep. The hotel sits next to the airport but it must be well insulated because we did not hear the noise of planes. Personnel was friendly and accommodating; price was reasonable; all necessary amenities provided. Very good hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place! Clean and quiet, free internet”
Reviews.Author: Twirlgrrl
Reviews.Content: The airport La Quinta is a really nice hotel! I am a budget traveler and usually stay at the Red Roof Inn or the Motel 6, so that gives you an idea of my expectations and standards. We splurged on a Monday night at the La Quinta because we needed internet access and the Red Roof was full. I'm so glad we got to spend the night in comparative luxury. The La Quinta was renovated about two years ago and everything is new and shiny, from the tile in the bathroom to the paint in the hallways. Either it was deserted or the walls are thick, because we didn't hear evidence of another guest the whole time in our room. We heard airplanes in the morning, which is to be expected since the hotel is right next to the airport, but they sounded much quieter than they do from the Red Roof or Motel 6. High-speed internet was furnished via in-room cable and worked great with no passwords or connection fees required. The room was ultra clean. There was a blow dryer, shampoo, and a coffee maker in the room, as well as a desk, but no fridge or microwave--those would have been the icing on the cake. The front desk staff was friendly and solicitous--they even called when we'd been in our room a few minutes to make sure everything was satisfactory. There was plenty of parking and this hotel really is right next to the airport, though a few blocks' drive from the airport entrance. One small problem is that the wheelchair/stroller entrance is only on the airport-facing side of the lobby, so if you need to enter on wheels (or wheel your luggage in) you have to drive around to that side of the hotel, and it's not obvious that this would be necessary from the parking lot. The hotel is situated on the "hotel strip" just next to the airport, and there are several restaurants nearby. The closest stores include a Jack-In-The-Box, a Taco Bell, two gas stations, and a 7-Eleven, but I also saw a bunch of sit-down restaurants further down the street toward the airport. We didn't have a chance to check out the continental breakfast or the pool. Overall, from a no-frills, budget-traveler perspective, this place was extraordinarily clean and quiet for an airport hotel and I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great value if you can get their weekend rate!”
Reviews.Author: rockychocbill
Reviews.Content: The review from andywa below basically sums up my experience at this property. I have tried 3 other hotels in the Seatac area in the past including the Clarion, Econo Lodge and Best Western Executive. I feel La Quinta offers the best overall value especially if you can get their "Weekend Impulse" rate for $59. You need to book this rate directly on their web site. Just look under the specials tab. Our family of 4 stayed one night at the beginning and end of our trip to Orlando. The only thing we would have preferred would be 2 queen beds instead of the 2 doubles. It was a bit cramped but that's the price you pay for getting such a great rate. For a 1 night stay it's fine. The elevators could use a sprucing up but everything else was clean and modern. Standard carb fest at the breakfast bar, including the make your own waffle machines that the kids love so much. There wasn't any fruit out the morning of our second stay but we didn't ask if any was available either. Staff were friendly when approached. I would highly recommend this property for anyone needing to overnight in the Seatac area.

Reviews.Title: “Ordinary / average”
Reviews.Author: Hello_It's_Me_21
Reviews.Content: I have tried about 8 hotels at the Seattle airport and am still looking for one which is inexpensive but nice. This one was ok but I'm still looking. The location is very convenient to the airport and there is are 2 restaurants across the street. The room was big but the bed was a bit hard and the blanket way too thin. The pillows were flat and hard. The bathroom was average size and the towels were thin and very scratchy. Everything was very clean. The desk staff are friendly. Free internet (dls plug) in the room. The free breakfast was your average continental breakfast: toast, bagels with tasteless cream cheese, a few cereals, yogurt, emply plate from what was hard boiled eggs, terrible coffee, the milk (I opened 2 indiviual serving size containers) and gone bad but I saw other people drinking and using it, toaster waffles, packaged muffins, etc. Free shutte to the airport every 30 minutes. Overall the hotel was ok but nothing more.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay . . .”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at La Quinta by Sea-Tac Airport last October before a very early flight. It had some positive aspects (low price, good service, clean room) but some drawbacks. * The bed and pillow were both hard as rocks. Very hard to get comfortable. * It was difficult to adjust the room temperature correctly; they have individual heating/air conditioning units on the wall for each room. Besides being very noisy, these units do not self-adjust like a thermostat does (you were either blasted by hot air, warm air, or cold air, and until you shut off the unit, it keeps blasting away). The room was very cold when I arrived, so I turned on the heat. I made the mistake of leaving the heat on before going to sleep, and woke up sweating. * If you are leaving for a very early flight, the advertised "free breakfast" was unavailable. I left the hotel at 5:00 a.m., and if I remember correctly, the breakfast did not start until 6:00 a.m. Since the hotel attracts people who have very early flights, you would think they could put out the coffee and pastries earlier (their buffet doesn't require much staff attention). At least the coffee!

Reviews.Title: “cough cough ughh smokers on 6th floor and dirty rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on April 13/06 and requested a non smoking room. Well I got that but half the 6th floor is smoking/non smoking. There is nothing to stop the smoke from coming under the door. I have an infant and this was disgusting for us to breath. I booked this place for my trip to Portland and back to Victoria (April 17th) and 1st time was bad and the 2nd stay was nasty. We got a better room since we complained, but when I was in the shower in the morning, there was long brown hair on the shower wall and tub. If this is not clean, then what else was not cleaned?

Reviews.Title: “I could hear the guy belching in the next room.”
Reviews.Author: alonzogo
Reviews.Content: Stayed there one night before flying out of Sea-Tac. I wanted to try the La Quinta chain, and we paid the $97 rack rate for a double room. I am sorry we did not go with one of the many less expensive options in the area, and will not stay in a La Quinta hotel again. I could hear conversations, sneezing and belching through the walls. The room was basic at best, and was missing some common-sense items such as a soap dish for the bathroom sink. The bed sheets and blanket were thin and worn. We did nothing more than sleep here and did not take advantage of the included breakfast, so I cannot comment on anything other than the room.

Reviews.Title: “A good deal”
Reviews.Author: jewels1Philadelphia
Reviews.Content: After kicking around all the possibilities for a one-night stay @ the airport, we went with this hotel based mainly on price ($85). It was the right choice. The staff was helpful, and the room was clean, quiet and modern. Free continental breakfast was fine -- coffee, cereal, rolls, juice, fruit. The shuttle service is good, too. The morning we planned to leave the hotel, we had to go to one of the off-aiport rental car places and weren't sure if the shuttle would take us there. The driver who picked us up at the airport when we landed assured us it would, and sure enough the next day another driver dropped us at the rental car spot after making the rounds at the airport to drop off other passengers.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal for the Price, and Clean Too!!”
Reviews.Author: newburyengineer
Reviews.Content: On our cruise to Alaska, needed a one night stay in SeaTac not to far driving distance from the pier. On our way up driving from Los Angeles to Seattle this was our 3rd Hotel. It was by far the best! The room was clean, the pool looked well maintained. The continental breakfast was above average. All in all would recommend it and use it again if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My son, husband and I recently stayed at this hotel and we would recommend it. It's a nice clean hotel and it's convienently located right next to the airport. Although it is literally right next to the airport, we couldn't hear any airport noise from our room, which was nice. If you're looking for a reasonably priced, good hotel I would recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful service at la quinta”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked two nights at the La Quinta Seatac via internet, got good rates, the hotel was way above our expectations, the staff was exceptionally helpful - they allowed us to check in way before check in time and thus we gained many hours of enjoyment of the lovely city of Seattle. What the staff doesn't ell you is that there is an express bus across the street which takes you to downtown Seattle and there is no reason to take a taxi as they suggested; this was a big saving for us(we are a retired couple). Would certainly go there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: cuinkempsville
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay if you are looking for a hotel close to the airport. The room was clean, the staff was helpful, the breakfast was good, and the shuttle is great! I have booked another reservation here for my upcoming trip! A+

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: Raleigh307
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August 04, at the end of an extended vacation in the Pacific Northwest. It is right next to the airport, so a good location to fly out from. The room was excellent, well equipped and clean, comfortable and best of all, I booked a last minute deal on their website, for a great price, ($60) even though it was a week out. The breakfast was good and the shuttle to the airport was prompt and fast. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, good free breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ProfSpice
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights while attending a meeting at the Doubletree across the street. You can make your own waffles at the continental breakfast. Quick and convenient free shuttle to the airport. I needed to get to a pharmacy and the desk staff went out of their way to help me out!

HotelInfo.Name: La Quinta Inn & Suites Seattle Sea-Tac
HotelInfo.Address: 2824 South 188th St, Seattle, WA 98188
